Data: 2.05pm England have won the toss and will bat. Both sides are unchanged and despite forecasts of poor weather, the sun is shining and we are set for a prompt start. There is a lot of rain to the south, however, so fingers crossed.
Lee to Joyce, no run good start, on middle, flicked into the leg side, a lose throw to the keeper and all very messy as fielders dive to save overthrows
Lee to Joyce, 1 run pushed gently into the leg side, Lee springs across to field and ends up in a heap as he tries to tumble and throw, all very undignified
Lee to Loye, no run short of a length outside off, a very loose and unconvincing swish from a man who needs a score to cement a World Cup berth
Lee to Loye, 1 wide wider and left alone (92mph, 148kph). Not to the umpire's liking, a bit of a harsh call
Lee to Loye, no run Loye shapes to play a heave/sweep to a ball fractionally short outside off stump and gets hit in the body. Lee follows through to give him some advice, Loye shrugs
Lee to Loye, no run outside off stump at 93mph (150kph) and left alone

Bracken to Joyce, FOUR runs loose, started wide and swung wider, Joyce punches that through the covers. he didn't look to have timed it at all but the ball keeps trundling and although Hussey dives and pulls it back, it had already hit the boundary marker
Bracken to Joyce, no run turned to midwicket
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run wide again, and this wasn't timed and it bobbles out into the covers
Bracken to Loye, no run leg side, off Loye's pads and it bobbles very fine to Gilchrist who takes two steps across to gather
Bracken to Loye, no run short again but also down the leg, off Loye's thigh pad and Gilchrist has to move with a little more speed to take it
Bracken to Loye, no run Loye takes a big step forward, gets a thick inside edge onto his pad and it loops into space on the leg. A hint of inswing there
Lee to Joyce, no run slanted across the left hander, Joyce shoulders arms
Lee to Joyce, no run short, Joyce up on his toes and steers the ball to backward point where Clarke makes a diving stop to his right
Lee to Joyce, no run Joyce forward and pushes to point
Lee to Joyce, no run Joyce again has to use his height to get over that and the ball trundles towards extra cover
Lee to Joyce, (no ball) short, too quick for Joyce (93mph/150kph) and it's through him by the time he plays at it.
Lee to Joyce, FOUR runs long hop, pulled convincingly in front of square on the leg, four all the way
Lee to Joyce, no run defensive push to point
Bracken to Loye, FOUR runs banged it and thumped with real oomph through midwicket. It went like a tracer bullet. That one was for Chappelli
Bracken to Loye, no run fuller and a good line, pushed back up the pitch
Bracken to Loye, no run angled across the right hander and Loye not at all interested
Bracken to Loye, 1 run Loye stands upright and stays back, choosing to play it late as he opens the face and runs the ball to third man
Bracken to Joyce, no run Joyce moves forward early, it's outside off and he leaves
Bracken to Joyce, no run short of a length, Joyce plays defensively into the covers
Lee to Loye, no run full outside off stump, a really loose drive that ends up bobbling towards the slips
Lee to Loye, no run a massive swing as he tries to sweep Lee, misses by some way. You can almost hear Chappell teeing off ...
Lee to Loye, no run outside off at 92.8mph (149.5kph) and Loye leaves it
Lee to Loye, (no ball) outside off, too wide to tempt Loye but wide enough for the umpire to signal it
Lee to Loye, no run Loye goes forward to defend, a little more bounce and it raps him on the bottom hand and trickles into the leg side
Lee to Loye, FOUR runs much better shot and a real confidence booster, full and wide and driven along the ground between cover and extra cover
Lee to Loye, (no ball) another attempted sweep which Loye again misses but Lee oversteps by some way
Lee to Loye, no run driven, but off balance and the ball scoots to mid-on rather than through the off side
Bracken to Joyce, no run Joyce leaves one outside off
Bracken to Joyce, no run same line, with a bit more bounce, and again Joyce pulls inside the ball
Bracken to Joyce, no run Joyce plays defensively into the off side
Bracken to Joyce, no run almost a replay of the second ball, Joyce leaves outside off stump
Bracken to Joyce, no run tighter line, Joyce back and punches the ball down and into the covers
Bracken to Joyce, no run jabbed towards backward point and Clarke sprints in like an enthusiastic puppy
McGrath to Loye, no run Loye back and across to block ... 82mph/132kph
McGrath to Loye, no run Loye again takes a step across his stumps and pushes it to midwicket. he looked slightly off balance with both those shots
McGrath to Loye, no run nice length, not letting Loye get forward. This one is patted to extra cover
McGrath to Loye, 2 runs short and an unconvincing and not timed pull, the ball positively puffs through midwicket
McGrath to Loye, no run first-rate yorker which Loye digs out
McGrath to Loye, FOUR runs super shot, Loye climbs on his toes and punches the ball off the back foot through the covers.
Bracken to Joyce, no run Joyce leaves one short of a length outside off
Bracken to Joyce, no run Joyce shuffles across and jabs at that one, it kept low and he missed it, even if he had edged it wouldn't have carried
Bracken to Joyce, FOUR runs Bracken's excellent line wavers, he bowls short and Joyce thumps it through wide midwicket. With seven men on the off, Bracken can't drop it short
Bracken to Joyce, no run patted into the off side
Bracken to Joyce, no run flat batted to cover
Bracken to Joyce, 1 run steered to the right of Clarke at backward point, third man trots in to field

McGrath to Joyce, OUT short, Joyce looked to pull but didn't time it, didn't commit to hitting over the infield and Brad Hodge takes a really good catch with a full-length dive to his left at midwicket
McGrath to Bell, no run Bell takes a big step forward to meet the ball and blocks
McGrath to Bell, no run outside off and left, that one had some zing in it
McGrath to Bell, no run Bell into line and pats the ball back
McGrath to Bell, 2 runs a little too wide and cut through backward point, third man had some distance to go to his right and that allowed the second
McGrath to Bell, no run Bell tries to play a Loyesque heave through midwicket and misses
Lee to Loye, 2 runs full and wide, driven uppishly past a diving short extra cover, a good chase and relay field
Lee to Loye, no run patted with no force to Hogg at deepish cover, Bell had come for a run and would have been well out at the bowler's end had the shy at the stumps hit
Lee to Loye, no run played into the covers, this time with no alarms
Lee to Loye, no run right up there, virtual yorker length, and squeezed into the leg side
Lee to Loye, no run speared in outside off at 92.8mph/149.5kph, all all done so with a loud grunt
Lee to Loye, no run firm front-foot drive to mid-off
McGrath to Bell, no run right on the money with Adam Gilchrist standing up to the stumps. Defended into the covers
McGrath to Bell, 1 run hint of width this time and some extra bounce too - a late deflection down to third man
McGrath to Loye, no run perfect line and length from McGrath - he's a bowler reborn after his horror story at Melbourne. So far
McGrath to Loye, no run a flashier stroke from Loye, but still no width to work with, cover tidies up
McGrath to Loye, no run tighter to the stumps, and defended solidly back down the pitch
McGrath to Loye, no run excellent over, just one run from it, as this one fizzes past off stump with no stroke offered
Lee to Bell, no run drawn onto the front foot, defended to short cover
Lee to Bell, no run pushed back onto his stumps this time, but same result. Tight bowling, as the run-rate slips below 3.5 an over
Lee to Bell, 1 run width, and worked down to third man, where McGrath fields to loud and not entirely ironic cheers
Lee to Loye, (no ball) drawn forward in a tight defence. Played into the covers. Steady stuff from the Aussies
Lee to Loye, FOUR runs good strike, up and over midwicket for a rare boundary. That was banged in too short, and sits up nicely for Loye to slap out of sight.
Lee to Loye, no run better length, slightly wide of off stump, but then that's the line that has done for Loye this series
Lee to Loye, no run good finish to the over, good line, good length, Loye comes forward and drives out to cover
McGrath to Bell, no run a fraction short, but Bell can't get his swivel-pull away
McGrath to Bell, no run steady stuff once again from McGrath. Keeper's standing up, and Bell is cagily forward to defend
McGrath to Bell, FOUR runs that's a great strike from Bell! Pitched on middle-and-leg and just a bit too full, and caressed firmly through long-on!
McGrath to Bell, no run back on a better length, but McGrath's still muttering to himself about that last ball
McGrath to Bell, no run angled into the pads, but worked no further than short midwicket. Another economical over for Australia
Watson to Loye, no run good first delivery. Decent pace, hint of outswing, left alone by Loye
Watson to Loye, no run attacking intent from Loye, who stands tall to smear that into the covers, but it's not timed
Watson to Loye, no run full bunger, and Loye misses out as he slaps this one to cover
Watson to Loye, 1 wide way outside off stump and swinging further away
Watson to Loye, no run outside off again, but a tighter line and again no shot
Watson to Loye, FOUR runs short and spanked! That fizzed over midwicket! When he hits it, it does stay hit ...

Watson to Loye, FOUR runs two in two balls! A touch more orthodox this time, but the same result. Watson just losing his length at the end of that over, and he lacks the pace to get away with it on this slight pudding of a pitch
McGrath to Bell, no run lovely ball. Slapped into Gilchrist's gloves, waiting as they were over the top of off stump
McGrath to Bell, no run another fine take from Gilchrist as Bell aims a flashy drive but misses
McGrath to Bell, no run extra bounce from a good length, and Bell fends that uncomfortably to gully. All along the ground though
McGrath to Bell, no run good length and good bounce again. Gully tidies up
McGrath to Bell, no run classy drive, but not timed
McGrath to Bell, 1 run lovely over, right on the spot each time. This ball is pushed away off the front foot
Watson to Bell, 1 run handsome drive to get things back underway. Tidy field and shy from mid-off
Watson to Loye, 1 wide a fraction harsh there, but Loye offered no shot so the umpire made the call
Watson to Loye, no run tighter and fuller, and Loye drives out to the covers
Watson to Loye, FOUR runs far too much width, and Loye goes down on one knee to slap fiercely past point! Top strike!
Watson to Loye, no run down on one knee to slog-sweep, and that's a nice strike, but straight to square leg. Good thinking but misses out
Watson to Loye, no run driving once again, can't beat the field
Watson to Loye, 1 run more slog-sweeping! That would have been a massive wide, but Loye fetched it from way outside off stump, and toe-ended it over midwicket
McGrath to Loye, 1 leg bye angled into the pads, Loye sizes up a flick off one leg, but can't get bat on it. Bobbles into space behind square nonetheless
McGrath to Bell, 1 run good nudge off the hips from Bell, but England miss out on a second run as Hodge misfields at square leg. Neither batsman noticed ...
McGrath to Loye, no run perfect line and length this time. Pushed respectfully back up the pitch
McGrath to Loye, no run big scythe of the bat outside off stump, but can't bisect the cover fielders
McGrath to Loye, SIX runs thwack! There's Loye's signature shot, and it's flown all the way over backward square for a maximum! Fetched from outside off on one knee, and wonderfully timed!
McGrath to Loye, 1 run straighter this time, and prodded out to point. Good resumption from England
Bracken to Loye, no run good start from Bracken. Pitches middle-and-leg, angled across the right hander, Loye, who offers no shot. 82.5mph (133kph)
Bracken to Loye, no run Loye was contemplating the sweep-slog again, but backed out at the last minute and drove into the covers instead
Bracken to Loye, no run good line and length, no room for Loye to swing his arms as yet. Pushed out to point
Bracken to Loye, FOUR runs there was room that time! Away he goes again, and that's four more through square leg! It's a sweepathon at the SCG!
Bracken to Loye, no run advances down the pitch in a statement of intent, but played defensively at the last minute
Bracken to Loye, no run good finish, but that's another productive over for England and Loye, who is advancing towards his first ODI fifty
Watson to Bell, no run good shot for no runs. Bell opened his shoulders and flailed that down the ground. Mid-off intercepted
Watson to Bell, no run good response from Watson. Better length, and Bell's best attacking stroke can't beat the covers

Watson to Bell, OUT Mal Loye is run out. Bell steered it straight to backward point where Hayden picked the ball up and threw down the stumps at the striker's end ... Loye was not in the picture and even had Hayden missed Gilchrist would have had time to complete the run out. The calling was indecisive and t
Watson to Strauss, no run Strauss back and defends
Watson to Strauss, 2 runs flicked to midwicket where a misfield and allows Strauss to get off the mark
Watson to Strauss, 4 runs firm drive to mid-on who should have done better, he dived over the ball and it pulled up a yard inside the boundary
Bracken to Strauss, no run good length on off stump, defended into the covers
Bracken to Strauss, OUT loose drive outside off stump, minimal footwork and Gilchrist holds an edge at chest height to his left. A good delivery which seemed to pick up some zip off the pitch
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run speared across the right hander and he leaves it
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run similar ball, again Collingwood not tempted

Bracken to PD Collingwood, 1 run punched to mid-off, Hussey picks up and throws down the stumps at the non-striker's end ...the crowd gets excited, the fielders don't and the replay shows Collingwood was well in
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run fractionally outside off stump, defensive push
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run slightly wishy-washy drive, inside edge into his pads and the ball dobbles back to the bowler
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run again driven and not timed, the ball bobbles to mid-off
Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 run slower ball, full length, clipped to deep midwicket
Watson to Bell, no run good ball, just short of a length and Bell sparred at that
Watson to Bell, 1 run played a few yards into the off side, enough taken off the ball to allow a quick single as point sprinted in
Bracken to Bell, 1 run steered along to ground to third man
Bracken to PD Collingwood, 3 runs Collingwood takes a big stride to meet the ball and whips it through midwicket. McGrath gives chase and catches up with it a couple of yards inside the boundary
Bracken to Bell, no run Bell left that but it again picked up some pace off the wicket and Gilchrist took that on the rise
Bracken to Bell, no run cut firmly to point where Clarke makes fielding look easy
Bracken to Bell, 2 runs pulled between midwicket and mid-on, Hayden chases, dives but is left clutching at air ... McGrath round from deep midwicket to mop up
Bracken to Bell, no run left alone outside the off stump
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood right behind that, defended back to the bowler
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run opens the face of the bat late but directs the ball right to point
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run tries to flick the ball into space on the leg but finds short midwicket
Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 run checked drive to mid-on who is too deep to save the one
Watson to Bell, 2 runs leg side, turned fine, good running to come back for the second as Bell spotted that Bracken had to run round the ball to pick it up
Watson to Bell, 3 runs driven through extra cover, Hayden had plenty of ground to cover from sweeper, a good throw and Bell has to stretch to make the third
Lee to Bell, no run Bell pulls his bat inside the line of a ball three or four inches outside off
Lee to Bell, 1 run pushed to point and again a moment of hesitation from Bell before he set off
Lee to PD Collingwood, 2 runs clipped off his legs square on the leg side
Lee to PD Collingwood, no run short of a length at Collingwood's chest, he gets over it well and defends into the off side
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run well bowled, Lee finding a good line and Collingwood has to settle for defence
Lee to Bell, no run outside off at 92.5mph/149kph, left alone
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 wide leg-side wide, Gilchrist whips the bails off
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run too short and Collingwood angles the ball to third man
Hussey to Bell, no run rank long hop and Bell misses a pull ... he was through the shot early and Bell looks to the heavens in frustration
Hussey to Bell, 1 run cracking drive beats mid-off's dive but there's others around to tidy up
Hussey to PD Collingwood, no run driven to mid-off
Hussey to PD Collingwood, no run pushed into the covers
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 wide wide outside off stump, again Gilchrist takes the bails off as if that might give some protection against the umpire signalling
Hussey to PD Collingwood, no run flicked to midwicket
Hogg to Bell, 2 runs full and very wide, heaved to long-on
Hogg to Bell, no run tossed up, defended, much better line and length
Hogg to Bell, 1 run turned with the spin to long leg

Hogg to PD Collingwood, OUT block and run into the off side, Hussey sprints in, picks up, twists and throws down the stumps at the striker's end and Bell is well short. Australia's fielding coach gives it out and the third umpire agrees. Great fielding but again a sniff of indecision in the calling
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run off the mark straight away for Flintoff. Pushed to midwicket, but sensibly turns down a second
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run full-toss, driven down the ground for a measured single
Lee to PD Collingwood, (no ball) 1 run turned out to square leg, just dropped his wrists to nudge the single
Lee to Flintoff, 1 run shorter, and Flintoff is up on his toes, cutting that out to deep cover
Lee to PD Collingwood, no run fuller and faster, up to 90.3mph (145kph). Defended
Lee to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs thwacked, and effectively so! A fraction short of a length, and Collingwood was onto it in a flash, pulling emphatically through square leg!
Lee to PD Collingwood, 2 runs good running, nudged into the leg side. Hodge had a good distance to run in from deep square, and Collingwood was easily home
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run pushed out to cover this time. More running for Collingwood. He's been hard worked in the past week
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 2 runs stepped back into the crease to pull - clears McGrath at midwicket by a good couple of metres
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run on the back foot again, turned square this time
Hogg to Flintoff, no run defended with a phlegmatic nudge of the bat
Hogg to Flintoff, no run big stride this time, but the same result. Measured defence
Hogg to Flintoff, no run a big shout as Flintoff is stuck on the pad, but clearly going over
Hogg to Flintoff, 4 byes googly! And everyone is foxed. Flintoff is beaten, so is Gilchrist and so is Hayden at slip! A bonus for England, but well bowled by Hogg
Lee to PD Collingwood, no run full length and tailing in a fraction. Well dug out and pushed to midwicket
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 wide Collingwood steps across early, and Lee adjusts but too dramatically. That one is flung outside the tramlines on the off side
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run just back of a length, nurdled wide of gully, who stops well with a dive to his left, but the call is quick and the running is decisive
Lee to Flintoff, no run big cheers from the crowd as Lee takes a catch high above his head, but it's a bump ball
Lee to Flintoff, no run excellent full length, 90.5mph (145kph). Dug out and driven back down the pitch
Lee to Flintoff, FOUR runs too wide from Lee, and Flintoff uses his pace to slash outside off and give McGrath at third man a futile chase. Ironic cheers as he dives and slides over the ropes
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run another googly from Hogg, and Collingwood is beaten going for a cut
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 2 runs easy two into the leg side. Good use of the crease by Collingwood, who just nudged that round the corner
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run forward, and firmly driven. Straight to mid-off though
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run swept, and swept fine, but Lee is quick off the mark to save the second this time
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 leg bye loud appeal, but hugely optimistic as the batsmen cross for another extra
McGrath to Flintoff, 1 run just a fraction too short to be dangerous, Flintoff glides that past the keeper to third man
McGrath to PD Collingwood, no run lovely nagging length, six inches outside off. Collingwood tries to work it to leg, but no gap there
McGrath to PD Collingwood, no run on the spot again. Collingwood is back in his crease, defending with the bat angled downwards
McGrath to PD Collingwood, 1 run shorter and into the hips, turned square but without any force
McGrath to Flintoff, no run Flintoff shapes to advance, but McGrath adjusts late to force a defensive push
McGrath to Flintoff, 1 run shorter again, and dabbed to third man to complete a tidy over
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run big stride, and a measured drive into the covers
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run solidly forward and defended out to point. Squeaked appeal
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run groans again as Collingwood defends a touch tentatively outside off. Probing stuff
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 wide misdirected this time, speared down the leg side
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 wide flipper, but this one also goes wrong!
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run back on a better line, Collingwood is beaten by some sharp turn outside off
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run big step across the stumps, worked out to square leg
Hogg to Flintoff, no run short, but straight and turning back into Flintoff. Watchfully defended
McGrath to PD Collingwood, 2 runs nurdled out to square leg. Good power and placement
McGrath to PD Collingwood, 1 run outside off stump as per normal for McGrath. Collingwood finds the gap in the covers
McGrath to Flintoff, 2 runs shorter, and an attacking swipe from Flintoff brings third man into play. But he's safely back for the second before the throw comes in
McGrath to Flintoff, no run half an appeal from McGrath, that was fuller and swung late into Flintoff's pads. Missing leg by some distance
McGrath to Flintoff, no run good length once again. Defended
McGrath to Flintoff, no run lovely fluid strike from Flintoff, but it flies like a bullet straight to cover
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run defended off a good length outside off stump
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run down on one knee and worked square
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run another googly, half-picked this time and worked away
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run pushed out to point. Tidy line and length, and good tempting flight
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run steps across his stumps once again, and works round the corner
Hogg to Flintoff, no run forward with intent, but forced to hold fire on the big stroke. Good over
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run steady enough first up. Good line and length, and pushed back down the pitch
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run wide of off stump, whisked out to midwicket with a slightly mistimed drive
Watson to PD Collingwood, no run into position for a good-looking cover drive, but once again he hits the fielder
Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 run slower ball, angled onto the pads, Collingwood steps inside the line and nudges to square leg
Watson to Flintoff, 1 run and short fine leg quickly into the action as Flintoff skews a drive off the inside-edge
Watson to PD Collingwood, 2 runs nurdled to leg once again. Good pace on the ball allows two as the fielder rushes in from the square-leg boundary
Hogg to Flintoff, 3 runs another edge, but safe! Clarke gives chase, after Flintoff made room to leg, and pushed wide. Not a chance
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run forward and finds the gap with another push
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run another googly - Flintoff hasn't been able to pick him yet so has a big mow instead. An under-edge bobbles away
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run more expert gap-picking from Collingwood. He's being run off his feet today
Hogg to Flintoff, no run good flight deceives Flintoff again. Pushed into the covers
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run forward and that's a better-looking drive down to mid-off
Watson to Flintoff, 1 run good measured stroke down the ground. Flintoff biding his time
Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 run attractive strike through the covers. Swept up in the deep
Watson to Flintoff, no run full toss, but Flintoff can't pick the gap. Drilled straight to short cover
Watson to Flintoff, no run slower ball, and a good one too. Full-length and that would have been plumb lbw but for an inside-edge! Good bowling
Watson to Flintoff, 2 runs another gentle push down the ground. Good running from Collingwood
Watson to Flintoff, 2 runs width, and worked into the gap in the covers with a big swing of the blade. Good finish to another slightly leaky over
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 3 runs leaping turn outside off stump, and Collingwood dabs that high through the vacant slip. Short third man can't cut it off, so useful runs
Hogg to Flintoff, no run another googly, nicely defended
Hogg to Flintoff, 2 runs a touch quicker, Flintoff read it off the pitch and placed it behind point with a heavily-timed late cut. He's not enjoying this trial by spin, but he's surviving nonetheless
Hogg to Flintoff, no run
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run down on one knee, and that's slog-swept into the deep. No great timing, but another run
Bracken to Flintoff, 1 run a touch short first-up, and that's dabbed through the vacant slip off the back foot
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run wider, and whacked straight to point. A forceful cut from Collingwood, showing his intent
Bracken to PD Collingwood, no run wide of off stump again, but fuller. Driven back down the pitch and picked up in Bracken's followthrough
Bracken to PD Collingwood, 1 run good use of the feet, and a scampered single into the covers
Bracken to Flintoff, no run fuller and wider, Gilchrist up to the stumps. Flintoff plays with flat feet out to point
Bracken to Flintoff, 1 run excellent over from Bracken. This one is right up to the bat, and driven down to long-off for a jogged single
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run good length delivery, no spin on that one, pushed down the ground
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run extra bounce, that might have been the top-spinner
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 2 runs twisting delivery outside off stump, cut wide of point
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run dancing feet at the crease. Played square on the off side once again
Hogg to Flintoff, 1 run floated up into the blockhole, Hogg picks up in his followthrough
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run defended off the front foot
Hussey to Flintoff, no run turned behind square but straight to the fielder
Hussey to Flintoff, 2 runs chopped down to third man and they take on Lee's arm - not always wise - but get home
Hussey to Flintoff, FOUR runs wide long hop, Flintoff absolutely heaves that through midwicket and it races away
Hussey to Flintoff, 1 run full, Flintoff squeezes it into the covers
Hussey to PD Collingwood, 1 run Collingwood steps back, waits, and squirts it into space at midwicket
Hussey to Flintoff, no run Flintoff back and defends
Hogg to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs lovely sweep from outside off stump through square leg for his second boundary
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 2 runs similar shot but this time the field has been reinforced
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run defensively turned to square leg, Gilchrist scuttles out to field
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run two paces and turned round the corner to the fielder
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood back and flicks to backward square leg
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run sweep, ballooned round the corner but nobody there so an easy one
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run full toss outside off stump, thumped past mid-on
Lee to Flintoff, FOUR runs full length, Flintoff stands tall and smashes that through extra cover, there's a man in the deep but he has no chance
Lee to Flintoff, 1 run slower ball, spotted, and patted into the covers
Lee to PD Collingwood, no run clipped to midwicket where Hussey fields
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run full toss - he was trying for the yorker - and worked up to long-on

Lee to Flintoff, OUT superb reflex catch ... driven hard back at Lee, right into his hands, and he does really well to cling on to it in his follow through ... it was at a perfect height but it was travelling
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run back, turned to square leg who is in quickly
Hogg to PD Collingwood, no run driven to mid-off
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run flicked to long-on for an ambled single
Hogg to Dalrymple, 1 run Dalrymple stretches to sweep the ball, well controlled and worked round the corner
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 wide leg-side wide
Hogg to PD Collingwood, 1 run premeditated sweep, top edged but nobody near enough behind square on the leg to catch it
Hogg to Dalrymple, no run missed drive, Gilchrist whips off the bails but never a stumping chance
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run driven to extra cover who is 30 yards back, and a quick run
Lee to Dalrymple, 1 run yorker, Dalrymple jabs down and works the ball into the covers
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run again up in the blockhole and Collingwood gets that up to mid-on
Lee to Dalrymple, no run a rather nothing swish with zero footwork which he misses with
Lee to Dalrymple, 1 run waist-high full toss, well worked to midwicket. Dalrymple wanted a second but Collingwood not having any of it
Lee to PD Collingwood, 1 run another good yorker which is again well played to mid -on
Watson to PD Collingwood, 2 runs full toss, pulled into the leg side ... there's a man out there, although he cannot prevent the second
Watson to PD Collingwood, 2 runs driven in the air over the bowler, long-on round to cover. Collingwood didn't really get hold of that

Watson to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood takes two steps, Watson sees him coming and digs one in and Collingwood ends up on his haunches to avoid being hit. He stands up with a big grin on his face
Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 run thumped up the ground
Watson to Dalrymple, 1 bye slower leg cutter, Dalrymple completely foxed but it cannons off Gilchrist's knee and into the leg side allowing a bye
Watson to PD Collingwood, 1 run full toss, pulled hard at midwicket who makes a good stop but cannot stop the single
Bracken to PD Collingwood, 1 run hit hard down the ground to long-off
Bracken to Dalrymple, 2 leg byes premeditated sweep which he misses, but the ball flies off the front pad and goes down fine to third man
Bracken to Dalrymple, no run Dalrymple steps to leg to slash through the covers, misses, and the ball shaves the off stump
Bracken to Dalrymple, 1 run reverse sweep which catches the shoulder of the bat and ends up with backward point
Bracken to PD Collingwood, 2 runs well placed between cover and extra cover
Bracken to PD Collingwood, OUT with third man up, Collingwood tries to reverse sweep but the ball glances off the face of the bat and Gilchrist barely has to move
McGrath to Dalrymple, 1 run steered to backward point, always risky and had Hogg hit that would have been another run-out
McGrath to Nixon, no run blocked into the off side, Dalrymple wanted a single but Nixon was not going anywhere

McGrath to Nixon, 1 run, OUT Nixon almost converted that into a yorker but he squirted it to longish-on. Dalrymple turned for the second but Nixon sent him back far too late, the throw was good and Gilchrist took the bails off with Dalrymple yards from safety
McGrath to Plunkett, no run pushed to leg where Ponting makes a one-handed leaping stop to massive cheers
McGrath to Plunkett, no run dug in and Plunkett ducks
McGrath to Plunkett, 1 run heaved to long-on, not timed
Bracken to Plunkett, no run chipped on the bounce to midwicket
Bracken to Plunkett, 1 run swatted to long-on, Lee in quickly to scotch thoughts of a second
Bracken to Nixon, 1 run Nixon dabs to point for an easy one
Bracken to Plunkett, no run expansive drive from Plunkett. He missed
Bracken to Plunkett, 1 run full toss, mistimed by Plunkett and only the one to midwicket
Bracken to Nixon, 1 run slow and wide, no power from Nixon as he paddles to cover
McGrath to Nixon, 1 run one big stride from Nixon and he hits an attempted yorker down the ground
McGrath to Plunkett, 2 runs straight drive, up and over, and Clarke, who made considerable ground from long-on, made a terrific leaping stop to save the four
McGrath to Plunkett, 2 runs hit high into space around cow corner
McGrath to Plunkett, 1 run full toss thumped to Clarke at long-on
McGrath to Nixon, 2 runs low full toss, worked to wide long-on
McGrath to Nixon, OUT full toss, launched right down the throat of the man five yards inside the rope at cow corner. McGrath gives a wry smile and a shake of the head as his team-mates leap on him.
McGrath leads the team off to an amazing reception ... he turns just before he is engulfed by the pavilion and waves to all parts of the ground.

A really tight last ten overs from Australia that might be the difference between the sides. England were again indebted to Paul Collingwood as well as Andrew Flintoff - the two added 97 for the fifth wicket - but Australia bowled well and fielded superbly. We'll be back at 7.15pm (0815GMT) for the second innings.

After a long series of hearing Boonie and Beefy endlessly (in fairness, Beefy shut up around the middle of the Sydney Test), the Boonie doll has just been served up as a leg-side full toss to Andrew Miller and he smashed it ...straight into Andrew McGlashan who was writing a story and was unaware of other activity.
Sajid Mahmood to share the new ball. He too can be wayward ... will he find the spot from the off?
Plunkett to Gilchrist, 1 wide poor start, a wide well down the leg side
Plunkett to Gilchrist, 1 wide and another leg-side wide ... it is swinging into the left hander but Plunkett's radar is well off
Plunkett to Gilchrist, no run a better line, fullish and blocked to mid-off
Plunkett to Gilchrist, no run Gilchrist blocks into the off side. More swing for Plunkett
Plunkett to Gilchrist, 3 runs too full and driven firmly past extra cover
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 run a yelp of frustration from Plunkett as Hayden jabs down late, the ball shoots into the leg side for an easy one
Plunkett to Gilchrist, 2 runs banged in, uncontrolled top-edged hook from Gilchrist which he gets away with as it goes very fine. Mahmood was wide at long leg and so never in the frame
Plunkett to Gilchrist, no run outside off stump, Gilchrist shapes to smack it through the covers but doesn't get hold of it and thumps it into the pitch and from there to Plunkett
Mahmood to Hayden, no run loosener outside off stump, Hayden sniffily watches it pass
Mahmood to Hayden, 3 runs a fraction short, Hayden pulls off the front foot and off the toe of the bat as well
Mahmood to Gilchrist, no run driven into the covers, Bell gets his body into line
Mahmood to Gilchrist, 1 run steered into space in the off side,
Mahmood to Hayden, no run bouncer which Gilchrist doesn't so much duck as nod at
Mahmood to Hayden, no run decent ball, short and it seamed away from Gilchrist at 90mph (145kph)
Plunkett to Gilchrist, FOUR runs lovely shot, too much width and he leaned into that and crashed it past extra cover who never had a chance
Plunkett to Gilchrist, (no ball) 1 run flicked behind square on the leg, and a no-ball as well
Plunkett to Hayden, no run Hayden shapes to turn to leg, misses, and is struck in the nether regions. He's hard ... not even a grimace
Plunkett to Hayden, no run pushed to short extra cover who has come in about 12-15 yards from the bat on the drive
Plunkett to Hayden, 1 run steered to Panesar at third man
Plunkett to Gilchrist, 2 runs rather nonchalant/loose flip over point, high enough to be safe
Plunkett to Gilchrist, FOUR runs Gilchrist uses one of his lives ... he was looking to guide the ball to third man, it came back, he was completely cramped and it flew off the shoulder and over slip
Mahmood to Ponting, FOUR runs well-timed on drive, Panesar at mid-on dives but it's all a bit slow and for show and he's never near it
Mahmood to Ponting, no run defended back to the bowler
Mahmood to Ponting, 2 runs short, Ponting onto it in a trice and he launches it over midwicket. It plugs in the soft turf and Joyce catches the ball a yard in side the rope
Mahmood to Ponting, 1 run pushed into space in the covers
Mahmood to Gilchrist, no run another slower ball, a genuine edge as Gilchrist misread it but it falls a yard short of Flintoff at first slip
Plunkett to Ponting, 1 wide wide of off stump and that's a very harsh call. Swinging gently away to the slips but Ponting could have played it if he wished
Plunkett to Ponting, no run he played at that one! Short of a length and climbed past the bat as Ponting went for the pull. He's pumped up

Plunkett to Ponting, OUT GOT HIM! That's a massive breakthrough, and it's all credit to Plunkett there. Perfect line and length, just outside off and swinging away again, Ponting pushes with hard hands, and Andrew Strauss at slip takes a fine low catch!
Plunkett to Clarke, no run good start, full and swinging again. Clarke leaves alone
Plunkett to Clarke, no run lovely ball. Fuller length and late nip off the seam. Climbs over the top of off stump as Clarke shoulders arms
Plunkett to Clarke, (no ball) slight overstep, but good length again
Plunkett to Clarke, 1 wide oh dear, that's a bit loose. Wide outside off. Needs to keep concentrating
Plunkett to Clarke, no run better length and Clarke comes forward in a solid defence
Plunkett to Clarke, no run wide outside off stump, but that one is allowed to go by. Successful over
Mahmood to Gilchrist, 2 runs banged in on leg stump, Gilchrist hops across to fiddle out to midwicket
Mahmood to Gilchrist, no run pushed out to the covers off the front foot
Mahmood to Gilchrist, no run good full length, slower ball that time, and Gilchrist was a touch fooled as it looped down to off stump. Good bowling
Mahmood to Gilchrist, 1 run faster and shorter. Up beyond 80mph again and Gilchrist is late on his pull shot. A top-edge bounces down to fine leg
Mahmood to Clarke, no run width this time, and Clarke has a mow but misses - 147kph that time (91 mph)
Mahmood to Clarke, no run tidy finish to the over. Climbed off a good length at 91mph again, as Clarke shouldered arms
Plunkett to Gilchrist, 1 wide another one down the leg side. These are a bit wasteful

Plunkett to Gilchrist, OUT massive start for England! Beautiful delivery from round the wicket, tailing in late, beating a loose drive from Gilchrist and clipping the top of off stump! Perfect resumption from Plunkett, do England have the CB Series trophy within their grasp?
Plunkett to Hodge, no run nice follow-up from Plunkett. Good length, late movement away from the right-hander. Defended
Plunkett to Hodge, no run good bowling again. Outside off, hint of movement, left alone

Plunkett to Hodge, 1 run dropped! That was another perfect delivery from Plunkett. Burst off the pitch with late outswing, took the shoulder, and Collingwood at second slip could only parry a salmon leap to his left!
Plunkett to Clarke, no run defended watchfully. It's all happening here!
Mahmood to Hodge, no run solid defence. Good line and length from Mahmood
Mahmood to Hodge, no run back and into line. More rain on the radar ...
Mahmood to Hodge, FOUR runs banged in and wallop! Too short and Hodge stood tall to thwack that through square leg. Good batting
Mahmood to Hodge, no run slower ball. Reaches Nixon on the third bounce as Hodge leaves alone
Mahmood to Hodge, no run outside off stump once again. Left alone
Mahmood to Hodge, 1 run fuller and angled into the pads. Nudged into the leg side
Plunkett to Hodge, no run middle-and-leg, shaping away, pushed to midwicket
Plunkett to Hodge, no run outside off stump, Hodge goes back and across to defend

Plunkett to Hodge, 5 runs clipped into the leg side - could have been a close call on the run-out, but Joyce's throw is rubbish. Well wide of the stumps and the fielder backing up. Mahmood can't cut off the overthrows
Plunkett to Hussey, no run short of a length and angled across the left-hander. Hussey opts to leave alone as Nixon fields with a dive towards the slips
Plunkett to Hussey, no run short of a length. Too short to tempt a strike, but full enough for Hussey to leave alone
Flintoff to Hodge, 1 run clipped down to third man
Flintoff to Hussey, no run short of a length but straight as a die and leaping into Nixon's gloves. Hussey withdraws his bat
Flintoff to Hussey, no run in the channel outside off stump. No stroke offered again
Flintoff to Hussey, no run lovely ball, pitched an inch outside off and held its line. Good leave
Flintoff to Hussey, no run no stroke offered once again. Flintoff finding a good rhythm
Flintoff to Hussey, no run excellent over. Tight and accurate, Hussey content to let it all fly by
Plunkett to Hodge, FOUR runs short and Hodge stands tall once again to ping that through midwicket. Carbon-copy of his previous boundary!
Plunkett to Hodge, no run pitch it up he did, and a big appeal! Very adjacent, but a big inside-edge. Better bowling though
Plunkett to Hodge, FOUR runs wonderful shot. Over-pitched this time, and that's clobbered through the covers. Good counterattack
Plunkett to Hodge, FOUR runs runs are leaking everywhere now! Too full again, and angled onto the pads. That's a classy shot that fizzes through midwicket
Plunkett to Hodge, no run better line and length. Back outside off stump, and left alone
Plunkett to Hodge, no run back of a length, angled into the pads. Turned into the leg side
Flintoff to Hussey, no run right in the channel again. Hussey watches it sail by
Flintoff to Watson, no run right on the money again from Flintoff. He's been colossal in the last week
Flintoff to Watson, no run a bit of excitement as Watson is squared up
Flintoff to Watson, no run bouncer! And Watson was taken completely by surprise! The ball exploded off his glove and flew into the leg side
Flintoff to Watson, no run fuller length again, and Watson can only defend to complete a wicket maiden!
Mahmood to Hodge, no run forward, and driven into the covers
Mahmood to Hodge, 1 run back of a length, Hodge goes back and picks the gap on the off side
Mahmood to Watson, no run full length again, turned to midwicket
Mahmood to Watson, no run well bowled, tight on off stump, Watson has to shoulder arms
Mahmood to Watson, no run good stuff again. Extra bounce this time outside off, and Nixon takes high above his head
Mahmood to Watson, 3 runs slower ball, a fraction off line, and that's a firm clip into space beyond midwicket.
Flintoff to Watson, no run Watson back and across to defend
Flintoff to Watson, no run outside off stump, theatrical leave from Watson
Flintoff to Watson, 1 run Watson goes to leave alone but is slow pulling the bat out of the way and the ball clips it and shoots through the slips
Flintoff to Hodge, no run Flintoff presses on with his line just outside off and Hodge happy to leave
Flintoff to Hodge, (no ball) short of a length at 90mph (145kph), Hodge onto his toes, back and into line
Flintoff to Hodge, no run off-stump line, Hodge behind it and prods into the covers
Flintoff to Hodge, no run slightly leg-sidish, Hodge turns towards midiwcket but there are men out there
Mahmood to Watson, no run short of a length outside off, left alone
Mahmood to Watson, FOUR runs textbook off drive, superbly timed and placed a couple of yards wide of extra cover who never moved
Mahmood to Watson, no run driven straighter and not timed as well, mid-off skids round to field
Mahmood to Watson, no run Watson prods and is beaten
Mahmood to Watson, FOUR runs another sublime drive, slightly squarer and it shoots to the left of extra cover, hit on the up, elbow bent. The perfectionists will be purring with delight at those two
Flintoff to Hodge, 1 leg bye a swish and a miss, off the pads into the leg side
Flintoff to Watson, no run good line and length, Hodge into line with a straight bat
Flintoff to Watson, no run full length, defended off the front foot
Flintoff to Watson, 1 run genuine edge, drops short and to the right of Strauss, the one slip, and he can only parry it to third man
Flintoff to Hodge, no run short of a length outside off, no shot
Flintoff to Hodge, no run same line and length, consistent bowling and all at around 89mph/143kph
Panesar to Watson, no run blocked back to the bowler
Panesar to Watson, no run defended again, and the rain is starting to fall
Panesar to Watson, no run Panesar on the button after the resumption, blocked
Panesar to Watson, 1 run patted into the covers for an ambled single
Panesar to Hodge, 1 run well-placed drive to the man sweeping on the off
Panesar to Watson, no run short and Hodge tries to run it down to third man and misses
Dalrymple to Hodge, 1 run turned to backward square leg who is 10 yards in from the boundary
Dalrymple to Watson, no run wide outside off stump, a big swish and Nixon appeals for a catch and a stumping! 0 out of 2.
Dalrymple to Watson, no run patted down the pitch
Dalrymple to Watson, no run blocked again
Dalrymple to Watson, no run tried to glide down to third man and again missed
Panesar to Watson, SIX runs one step and a massive drive way over long-on, ten rows back
Panesar to Watson, FOUR runs full toss outside off, Watson looks to thump in straight, gets a thin edge and the ball trundles for four through the unprotected third man area
Panesar to Watson, 1 run more air from Panesar, driven to long-on
Panesar to Hodge, 1 run dropped into the covers for a single
Panesar to Watson, no run Watson aims a huge sweep, misses and it sneaks past his off stump
Panesar to Watson, 1 run driven into the pitch, Panesar parries above his head when he probably should have caught it and allows the single
Dalrymple to Watson, 1 run chopped down to third man, loose throw and a few flutters as overthrows loomed
Dalrymple to Hodge, 1 leg bye leg side, flicked with the spin to Panesar on the 45
Dalrymple to Watson, no run flowing drive right at Flintoff who stops it well at extra cover ... he's right back on the 30-yard line
Dalrymple to Watson, 1 run big swing and a miss, leg bye as it squirts out on the leg side
Dalrymple to Hodge, 1 run driven to the sweeper
Dalrymple to Watson, 3 runs driven in the air over backward point, Strauss dives and flicks the ball back

PD Collingwood to Watson, no run swing outside the off stump, he misses and Nixon whips the bails off and roars an appeal ... it's off to the third umpire. The appeal looked optimistic at first sight but on replay it was very close. He just got a touch of his foot back in time but it took about six replays.
PD Collingwood to Watson, no run superbly-timed cut right at point. A yard either way and that would have been productive
PD Collingwood to Watson, FOUR runs slower ball clubbed past a flailing Flintoff at extra cover
PD Collingwood to Watson, 1 run uppish drive to Flintoff who takes it on the half volley and hurls his throw at Nixon but no run-out opportunity
PD Collingwood to Hodge, 1 run full toss driven to long-on

PD Collingwood to Watson, OUT Oh my word. That is a brilliant catch. It was wide, Watson drove it uppishly to the left of backward point and Dalrymple leapt full length and took a one-handed catch four feet off the ground. There were gasps from the crowd as that was replayed.
Dalrymple to Hodge, no run shaped to cut but too close and he missed
Dalrymple to Hodge, 1 run driven to long-on
Dalrymple to Hogg, 1 wide leg side full toss, wonderfully taken at his feet by Nixon
Dalrymple to Hogg, 1 run driven to long-off, fielder and batsmen amble as all parties accept it's one and no more
Dalrymple to Hodge, FOUR runs nice shot, he waited and then smacked it square
Dalrymple to Hodge, 1 run full toss clipped to deep square leg
Dalrymple to Hogg, 1 run full toss again, almost a yorker, turned to deep midwicket
PD Collingwood to Hogg, no run speared in at leg stump, missed but it doesn't go far enough off the pad to allow a single
PD Collingwood to Hogg, no run shortish, Hogg back and pulls off a bottom edge into his foot, again no chance of a run
PD Collingwood to Hogg, no run outside off stump, Hogg looks to heave that over midwicket and misses, Nixon, standing up, takes well
PD Collingwood to Hogg, 1 run at last Hogg middles one, driven up to long-off
PD Collingwood to Hogg, no run yorker again, Hogg squirts it to backward point
Flintoff to Hodge, 1 run Caribbeanish off drive off the back foot, not really timed and deepish extra cover makes a diving stop
Flintoff to Hogg, no run Hogg steps to leg, Flintoff fires one in outside off stump on the crease and the batsman is left groping at air
Flintoff to Hogg, 1 run driven to the sweeper
Flintoff to Hodge, 3 runs turned to backward square leg, Panesar gets to the ball, flicks it back into the feet of Ed Joyce who in turn scrambles to keep it in play. Ugly but effective
Flintoff to Hogg, no run short and fast, Hogg swings at thin air
Flintoff to Hogg, 1 run yorker, Hogg steps to leg and chops the ball into the covers
PD Collingwood to Hogg, 1 run Full toss, thumped to Panesar at long-on and as a sign of the times, they don't risk one to his arm
PD Collingwood to Hodge, 1 run Hodge gives himself room, doesn't time it and it bobbles to Flintoff at extra cover
PD Collingwood to Hogg, FOUR runs full toss, smashed over cow corner and it bounces a yard inside the rope
PD Collingwood to Hodge, 1 run short, pulled past a diving midwicket but there's a man in the deep
PD Collingwood to Lee, no run Lee turns that round the corner, looks for a single but is sent back
Dalrymple to Hodge, SIX runs a big swat over midwicket about 20 rows back
Dalrymple to Hodge, no run Hodge shapes to hit another bigger hit but misses
Dalrymple to Bracken, no run pushed back, Dalrymple sprints to his right to field
Dalrymple to Bracken, 1 run driven to the right of Bell at extra cover and he throws himself forward and makes a really good stop
Dalrymple to Lee, 1 run full toss smacked to Bell who has to dive for a second time in as many balls to stop it
PD Collingwood to Lee, no run that was a real mow, which he missed by some way
PD Collingwood to Lee, no run speared in at Lee's legs and he is slow to get his bat down
PD Collingwood to Lee, FOUR runs waist-high full toss heaved over midwicket, Mahmood makes a sprawling dive on the boundary edge ...but it's in vain
PD Collingwood to Lee, FOUR runs full, hit straight and well for a one -bounce four. he really got hold of that
PD Collingwood to Lee, 1 run full toss, smashed to deep midwicket
PD Collingwood to Bracken, 2 runs hit high towards cow corner and although it hangs in the air for what seems like an eternity it drops between two incoming fielders

It's raining again and the umpires are consulting ... the crowd boo and all that happens is that the ball is changed. Liam Plunkett into the attack for his last over. Loud boos around the ground as the umpires take the players off as it gets heavier.
10.39pm This is bad for Australia. They should be 187 to win the game if it ends now. And if they are not playing in six minutes time (10.45pm/1145GMT) then it's all over. The countdown begins ...
10.41pm Still raining, covers are on and the stands are emptying fast.
10.42pm It's got heavier ... I suspect that is it. England are not celebrating yet but the grins are unmistakable.

10.45pm The Barmy Army are singing in the rain but there is now a report that the umpires are saying there are 10 minutes to go before the game can be called off! Utter confusion and a PA announcement would be nice.
10.50pm England's dressing erupts into celebration as the announcement comes through confirming that they have won this match by 34 runs and with it the CB Series 2-0.
Player of the Series Ricky Ponting.

From me, Martin Williamson, and from my fellow commentators Andrew Miller, Jenny Thompson, Will Luke and Andrew McGlashan, thank you for staying with us through the summer and for your kind comments. We are off to have a rest and will be back for the World Cup in a month's time.

Australia now head to New Zealand for three more ODIs starting next Friday in the Chappell-Hadlee series, games which are now more important than they were a week ago. If they lose that series then concerns will continue to grow.
England have not become world-beaters overnight, but they will be confident heading to the Caribbean. A fortnight ago they were a shambles, now they look a unit.

Well, that's the end of a long series and for Australia a defeat which is not the end of the world but which does raise some questions so soon before the World Cup. And a sad home farewell for Glenn McGrath, and a losing one also for John Buchanan.
England won by 34 runs (D/L method)
Player of the match is
